page.title: 12RECREATION IN GRANGETOWN
page.content:
{ {Ninian Park (167/758)}is the home ground of{Cardiff City A.F.C.} Nicknamed "The Bluebirds", their colours are blue shirts/white shorts, though their away strip is all yellow.
The ground capacity is 41,000 of which 12,000 are seated. During this season (1984-'85) the "City" were relegated from Division Two to Division Three.
Alan Durban is the current manager having been there just this season. The only player to gain full international honours this season was Nigel Vaughan.
In a survey carried out, only one in ten people said they watched Cardiff City play; most said they did not have time.
